symptoms.name: Pneumonia
symptoms.pattern: Most common acute infection in adults; approximately 20% in pediatric cases

symptoms.name: Skin lesions
symptoms.pattern: More frequent in children (60%) than adults (13%); often solitary at inoculation site

symptoms.name: Visceral abscesses
symptoms.pattern: Common in spleen, liver, adrenals, and kidneys; prostatic abscesses common in Australian males

symptoms.name: Encephalomyelitis
symptoms.pattern: Infrequent but potentially devastating; more common in Australia

symptoms.name: Osteomyelitis
symptoms.pattern: Can occur due to penetrating injuries or hematogenous dissemination

symptoms.name: Septic arthritis
symptoms.pattern: Common in acute disease; usually involves a single large joint

symptoms.name: Jaundice
symptoms.pattern: May predominate clinically in acute septicemic type

symptoms.name: Gastroenteritis
symptoms.pattern: May predominate clinically in acute septicemic type

symptoms.name: Meningitis
symptoms.pattern: May predominate clinically in acute septicemic type

symptoms.name: Pneumonia
symptoms.pattern: Can be present in acute cases

vital_signs.blood_pressure: May be low in septic shock

lab_values.WBC: May be normal, slightly elevated, or decreased (leucopenia)

risk_factors: Exposure to contaminated soil or water

imaging_findings.Chest X-ray: Bilateral fluffy opacities, focal infiltrates, effusions, lung consolidation
imaging_findings.CT scan: Multiple cavitating consolidations, hepatosplenic abscesses, psoas abscess, prostatic abscess

required: Isolation of Burkholderia pseudomallei from clinical specimens
